subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] A new hack?
author: Wiliam Clarke
full_text:
--0-886399304-1206994540=:87807
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Thanks Stefan, I appreciate it.  Also tonight I haven't had much luck with my RS 469.  I going to give the EVPm a shot again.  If you have any pointers please let me know?
  I haven't had much time to play with it.
   
  Thanks
   
  Rees

Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...> wrote: 
          Hi Rees,

your question isn't stupid - and you're not the only one who asked it. ;)

You need the QuickTime Player to watch Frank's cellphone videos.

Stefan

-- 

> Frank

> This is probably a stupid question, what type of program can I use to open this file?

> Thanks
> Rees

> Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> I mounted the '469 guts on a board, and added a 3 volt regulator to run the RS radio off the 12 volt supply. I have the sweep working so far, hopefully tomorrow I can test the radio with
> external sweep to see if it actually works. The frequency display is now useless, so it's face down, and the power and band buttons will be added to a new front panel. I'm not sure if I want to
> make this direct out, or make it just like any other box. The audio should be more better than anything I've done so for, at least it sounded real good when I was using a manual control, but only
> could tune half the AM or FM bands wihtout the negative tuning voltage component. 

> The radio playing in the background is just C2C on a regular radio. 

> Frank-S
